lead_paragraph: It has become practically routine for President Obama, in his final year in office, to acknowledge the United States’ unsavory history in a country he was visiting.

headline.print_headline: Acknowledging Thorny Issues Abroad, Obama Reframes American Power
headline.main: Obama, Acknowledging U.S. Misdeeds Abroad, Quietly Reframes American Power

snippet: It has become practically routine for President Obama, in his final year in office, to acknowledge the United States’ unsavory history in a country he was visiting....
abstract: Max Fisher The Interpreter column observes that Pres Obama's acknowledgment of CIA-led bombing and paramilitary campaign in Laos during Vietnam War is in keeping with his pattern of acknowledging United States' unsavory history in number of countries he has visited; notes these acknowledgments are of piece with Obama's worldview, and his belief in introspection and need to overcome past.
